src:
Novi Edge z nadvse zanimivim logotipom!

05 Nov 2019, 06:16

Če ste na tekočem z dogajanjem na področju spletnih brskalnikov, ste zagotovo seznanjeni s tem, da je podjetje Microsoft konec lanskega leta uradno potrdilo, da pripravlja povsem novi spletni brskalnik Edge, ki bo temeljil na osnovi pogona Chromium. Ta je med drugim uporabljen v brskalnikih Google Chrome, Opera, Vivialdi in nekaterih drugih. Microsoft bo sicer zaradi združljivosti s spletnim brskalnikom Internet Explorer moral pri novincu obdržati združljivost, a to naj ne bi vplivalo na nove možnosti brskalnika Edge. Pogon z novimi možnostmi bo v spletni brskalnik Edge vpeljan postopoma, deležni pa ga bodo le uporabniki operacijskega sistema Windows 10.
Poskusna različica spletnega brskalnika Edge s pogonom Chromium je na voljo že nekaj mesecev, med uporabniki pa se je odrezala presenetljivo dobro. To ne preseneča, saj so se Microsoftovi programerji osredotočili predvsem na osnove, ki so za spletno brskanje najbolj pomembne, zanesljivost delovanja ter na številne dodatke, ki jih boste lahko dogradili v vaš spletni brskalnik. Omogočili so tudi možnost sinhronizacije, kar bo omogočalo, da boste lahko dodatke, zgodovino brskanja in druge pomembne možnosti nemoteno prenesli na Microsoftov brskalnik Edge.
Piko na i pa so novemu spletnemu brskalniku Ege pri podjetju Microsoft nedavno dodali s pripravo povsem novega logotipa. Ta dejansko predstavlja odmik od bolj ali manj stilizirane črke "e", kot se je doslej pojavljala v logotipu spletnega brskalnika Internet Explorer in Edge. Pri novem logotipu za novi Edge dejansko gre za modro-zelen vrtinec, ki sicer še vedno spominja na črko "e", a se oblikovno precej razlikuje od dosedanjih logotipov Microsoftovih brskalnikov. Nekateri uporabniki sicer menijo, da novi logotip nekoliko spominja na logotip brskalnika Firefox, drugi pa vidijo željo računalniškega giganta po odmiku od "boleče" zapuščine nepriljubljenega Internet Explorerja,



Povezave: Microsoft
text:
New Edge with a very interesting logo!

05 Nov 2019, 05:16

If you are up to date with the developments in the area of web browsers, you are certainly aware that Microsoft officially confirmed at the end of last year that it is building a brand new Edge web browser based on the Chromium drive. This one is used, among other things, in Google Chrome, Opera, Vivialdi, and some. Microsoft will need to keep compatibility with the newcomer due to its compatibility with Internet Explorer, but this will not affect the new capabilities of Edge. The drive with the new features will be introduced gradually into the Edge web browser, and will only be shared with Windows 10 users.
A trial version of the Chromium-powered Edge web browser has been available for months, and it performed surprisingly well among users. This is not surprising since Microsoft programmers have focused primarily on the basics that are most important for web browsing, reliability, and the many add-ons that you can build on your web browser. They have also enabled the sync option, allowing you to seamlessly transfer your add-ons, browsing history, and other important options to Microsoft's Edge browser.
The dots on i have recently been added to Microsoft's new Ege web browser by creating a brand new logo. It actually represents a departure from the more or less stylized letter "e" as it appeared so far in the Internet Explorer and Edge web browser logo. The new Edge logo is actually a blue-green swirl, still reminiscent of the letter "e", but much different in design from previous Microsoft browser logos. While some users think the new logo is somewhat reminiscent of the Firefox browser logo, others see the computer giant's desire to move away from the "painful" legacy of the unpopular Internet Explorer,



Links: Microsoft
